fr.spacefox.confusablehomoglyphs

Class Categories

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.spacefox.confusablehomoglyphs.Categories

  • public class Categories
extends java.lang.Object
    Retrieves data about unicode writing system alias and character category of a character or a string.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    SpaceFox

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • fromInternal

        public static Categories fromInternal()
        Create an instance of Categories and load associated JSON data. As the loading is quite long, this object should be kept alive.
        Returns:
        an initialized instance of Categories
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the JSON data can't be loaded

      • fromJson

        public static Categories fromJson(java.lang.String jsonFileName)

      • aliasAndCategory

        public AliasAndCategory aliasAndCategory(java.lang.String character)
        Retrieves the script block alias and unicode category for a unicode character. 
             >>> categories.aliasAndCategory("A")
     ("LATIN", "L")
     >>> categories.aliasAndCategory("τ")
     ("GREEK", "L")
     >>> categories.aliasAndCategory("-")
     ("COMMON", 'Pd')
        Parameters:
        character - A unicode character (if the string contains more than 1 character, only the 1st will be used)
        Returns:
        The script block alias and unicode aliasAndCategory for a unicode character.

      • aliasAndCategory

        public AliasAndCategory aliasAndCategory(char character)
        Same as aliasAndCategory, directly on a character. Warning: does not handle characters on supplementary planes like emojis.
        Parameters:
        character - A unicode character
        Returns:
        The script block alias and unicode aliasAndCategory for a unicode character.
        See Also:
        aliasAndCategory(String)

      • alias

        public java.lang.String alias(java.lang.String character)
        Retrieves the script block alias for a unicode character. 
             >>> categories.alias("A")
     "LATIN"
     >>> categories.alias("τ")
     "GREEK"
     >>> categories.alias("-")
     "COMMON"
        Parameters:
        character - A unicode character (if the string contains more than 1 character, only the 1st will be used)
        Returns:
        The script block alias.

      • alias

        public java.lang.String alias(char character)
        Same as alias, directly on a character. Warning: does not handle characters on supplementary planes like emojis.
        Parameters:
        character - A unicode character
        Returns:
        The script block alias.
        See Also:
        alias(String)

      • category

        public java.lang.String category(java.lang.String character)
        Retrieves the unicode aliasAndCategory for a unicode character. 
             >>> categories.aliasAndCategory("A")
     "L"
     >>> categories.aliasAndCategory("τ")
     "L"
     >>> categories.aliasAndCategory("-")
     'Pd'
        Parameters:
        character - A unicode character (if the string contains more than 1 character, only the 1st will be used)
        Returns:
        The unicode aliasAndCategory for a unicode character.

      • category

        public java.lang.String category(char character)
        Same as aliasAndCategory, directly on a character. Warning: does not handle characters on supplementary planes like emojis.
        Parameters:
        character - A unicode character
        Returns:
        The unicode aliasAndCategory for a unicode character.
        See Also:
        category(String)

      • uniqueAliases

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> uniqueAliases(java.lang.String string)
        Retrieves all unique script block aliases used in a unicode string. 
             >>> categories.uniqueAliases("ABC")
     {"LATIN"}
     >>> categories.uniqueAliases("ρAτ-")
     {"GREEK", "LATIN", "COMMON"}
        Parameters:
        string - A unicode String
        Returns:
        A set of the script block aliases used in a unicode string.
